paragraphs.title: Introduction
paragraphs.text:
%md
This unix shell (`sh`) workbook will extract and convert zipped shape files to csv files for further processing. Start by upload zipped field survey and land cover map shape files using the minio browser and update the variables in the code blocks below. The variables are not scoped for the entire workbook, therefore the two zip files should be run as two independent code blocks. An exit value `143` denotes a time-out for the code block this can resolved by increasing the time-out value in the `sh` interpretor settings.

msg.data: This unix shell (sh) workbook will extract and convert zipped shape files to csv files for further processing. Start by upload zipped field survey and land cover map shape files using the minio browser and update the variables in the code blocks below. The variables are not scoped for the entire workbook, therefore the two zip files should be run as two independent code blocks. An exit value 143 denotes a time-out for the code block this can resolved by increasing the time-out value in the sh interpretor settings.

paragraphs.title: Field Survey
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# File paths
shapeFileDirectory="/data/lcm/survey/shapefile"
shapeFileArchive="field_survey.tar.gz"
shapeFileName="FieldSurvey_Shape.shp"
csvDirectory="/data/lcm/survey/csv"
csvName="FieldSurvey.csv"

# Extract shape files
tar xf $shapeFileDirectory/$shapeFileArchive -C $shapeFileDirectory

# Create output directory if missing
if [ ! -d "$csvDirectory" ]; then
    mkdir -p $csvDirectory
fi

# Convert to CSV
ogr2ogr -explodecollections -f CSV $csvDirectory/$csvName $shapeFileDirectory/$shapeFileName -lco GEOMETRY=AS_WKT

paragraphs.title: Land Cover Map
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# File paths
shapeFileDirectory="/data/lcm/maps/shapefile"
shapeFileArchive="LCM2015_GB.tar.gz"
shapeFileName="LCM2015_GB.gdb"
csvDirectory="/data/lcm/maps/csv"
csvName="lcm25mWKT" # extension will be added

# Extract shape files
tar xf $shapeFileDirectory/$shapeFileArchive -C $shapeFileDirectory

# Create output directory if missing
if [ ! -d "$csvDirectory" ]; then
    mkdir -p $csvDirectory
fi

# Convert to CSV
ogr2ogr -explodecollections -f CSV $csvDirectory/intermediate.csv $shapeFileDirectory/$shapeFileName -lco GEOMETRY=AS_WKT

# Switch directory for next step
cd $csvDirectory

# Split into chunks
split --number=l/20 intermediate.csv $csvName.

# Remove first line header row
sed -i "1d" $csvName.aa

# Clean up
rm intermediate.csv
